conversation.en_sentence: I'll go ask the administration department what's up.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしたのか、管理部に問い合わせてみるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Hey Tracy, do you know if something is wrong with the printer?
conversation.ja_sentence: ねえトレイシー、プリンターに何か問題があるか知ってる？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh is that right.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, but it shows that it's connected to wifi.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、でもワイファイに接続されいるって表示が出てるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you know when the issues will be solved?
conversation.ja_sentence: 問題がいつ解決されるか知ってる？

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, please let me know.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかった、知らせてね。

conversation.en_sentence: So, apparently we have some technical issues and the printer and wifi isn't working.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうやら技術的な問題があって、プリンターとワイファイが機能してないようだ。

conversation.en_sentence: I think I will do that too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕もそうしようかな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゴードン チュウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi Sam, how are you doing.
conversation.ja_sentence: サムさんこんにちは、お元気ですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ゴードン チュウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Right.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゴードン チュウさん
conversation.en_sentence: I've been following up with the shipping line on that but they haven't released the bookings yet.
conversation.ja_sentence: それについて船会社に確認をとっているのですが、未だ予約が開始されていません。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゴードン チュウさん
conversation.en_sentence: They typically open up the bookings a month before the sailing date.
conversation.ja_sentence: 通常は出港日の１ヶ月前には予約を開始するんですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゴードン チュウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, it should be soon.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、もうすぐです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゴードン チュウさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll keep my eye out on this, and let you know once the booking is confirmed.
conversation.ja_sentence: 注意してみておきますので、予約の確認ができたらご連絡いたします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゴードン チュウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sure what is it?
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです、どうしました？

conversation.ja_speaker: ゴードン チュウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sure I can do that.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんできますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゴードン チュウさん
conversation.en_sentence: So just in metric tons would be okay right?
conversation.ja_sentence: メートル法のトンのみで大丈夫ですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ゴードン チュウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Alright I will update it accordingly.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、そのように更新しておきます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゴードン チュウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Will that be all today?
conversation.ja_sentence: 本日は、以上ですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ゴードン チュウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Have a good one.
conversation.ja_sentence: さようなら。

conversation.ja_speaker: ティム マニングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hello, my name is Tim Manning from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、Ａ社のティム マニングと申します。

conversation.ja_speaker: ティム マニングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm from Company A's collections department.
conversation.ja_sentence: Ａ社集金部の者です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ティム マニングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm calling in regards to an unpaid invoice.
conversation.ja_sentence: 未払いの請求書についてお電話させていただいております。

conversation.ja_speaker: ティム マニングさん
conversation.en_sentence: There is an outstanding invoice under your company.
conversation.ja_sentence: 御社の名前で未払いの請求書がございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ティム マニングさん
conversation.en_sentence: The invoice number is 57235.
conversation.ja_sentence: 請求書番号は５７２３５です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ティム マニングさん
conversation.en_sentence: The bill of lading shows that it's textiles shipped from Norway to Japan.
conversation.ja_sentence: 出荷通知にはノルウェーから日本に発送されたテキスタイルとなっています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ティム マニングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Is that right?
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ティム マニングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you tell me where I can call instead then?
conversation.ja_sentence: では、代わりにどちらに連絡すればいいか教えていただけますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ティム マニングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you tell me the contact information?
conversation.ja_sentence: 連絡先を教えていただけますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ティム マニングさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's TManning@CompanyA.com.
conversation.ja_sentence: TManning@CompanyA.comです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ティム マニングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうもありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ティム マニングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Goodbye.
conversation.ja_sentence: 失礼します。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi, I'm Sam from Company B.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、Ｂ社のサムです。

conversation.en_sentence: May I ask what this is about?
conversation.ja_sentence: どのようなご用件か伺ってもいいですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Do you know what product that is?
conversation.ja_sentence: どの製品かわかりますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Textiles?
conversation.ja_sentence: テキスタイル？

conversation.en_sentence: That's not something our office handles.
conversation.ja_sentence: それはこちらの事務所では扱っていない物ですね。

conversation.en_sentence: It might be from a different department.
conversation.ja_sentence: 他の部署かもしれません。

conversation.en_sentence: I would recommend calling our office in New York.
conversation.ja_sentence: 弊社のニューヨーク事務所にご連絡することをお勧めします。

conversation.en_sentence: They should be able to sort this out.
conversation.ja_sentence: そちらで対応できるはずです。

conversation.en_sentence: I can send you the contact information through email.
conversation.ja_sentence: メールで連絡先をお送りしますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Can you tell me your email address?
conversation.ja_sentence: メールアドレスを教えていただけますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Okay I will send it to you now.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、今送りますね。

conversation.en_sentence: Have a good one.
conversation.ja_sentence: よろしくお願いします。

conversation.en_sentence: Linda, I have something important to discuss with you.
conversation.ja_sentence: リンダ、ちょっと大事な話があるんだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: Did you know that we will have a product development meeting tomorrow?
conversation.ja_sentence: 明日製品開発会議があるって知ってた？

conversation.en_sentence: I was wondering if you could record the minutes.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君が記録係をやってくれないかと思って。

conversation.en_sentence: Can you do it?
conversation.ja_sentence: やってくれる？

conversation.en_sentence: Just something to write with, some paper, and your phone.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何か書くものと、電話があれば大丈夫。

conversation.en_sentence: You have recorded minutes before, right?
conversation.ja_sentence: 記録係はやったことあるでしょ？

conversation.en_sentence: Exactly.
conversation.ja_sentence: その通り。

conversation.en_sentence: It's recorded documentation that is used to inform people of what happened during the meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: 会議で何を話したのか、みんなに知らせるための記録書類だから。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, you need to begin by taking attendance as everyone arrives.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだね、まずはみんなが席についたら出席をとって。

conversation.en_sentence: Make sure to record all decisions as made.
conversation.ja_sentence: 決まった事は全部記録するようにして。

conversation.en_sentence: Be sure to ask for clarification as necessary.
conversation.ja_sentence: 必要があれば聞いて確認してね。

conversation.en_sentence: Write clear, brief notes instead of writing everything verbatim.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一語一句全部書かなくていいから、はっきりと簡潔にね。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure Joan, I have a few minutes.
conversation.ja_sentence: はいジョアン、少しなら大丈夫ですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: What's up?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしました？

conversation.en_sentence: Sure, what's wrong?
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、何か問題でもあったんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: That's good.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは良かった。

conversation.en_sentence: The agent, does he seem reliable to you?
conversation.ja_sentence: そのエージェントですが、君には信頼できるように見えますか？

conversation.en_sentence: OK, when is your next meeting with him?
conversation.ja_sentence: そうか、次はいつ会うことになっていますか？

conversation.en_sentence: That sounds perfect.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you need me to come?
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕も出た方がいいですか？

conversation.en_sentence: OK, let me know what happens.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあどうなったか教えてください。

conversation.en_sentence: Make everything clearly and then we will decide the time of the signing ceremony.
conversation.ja_sentence: 全て明確にしておいてくださいね、そうしたら今度は署名式の日取りを決めますから。

conversation.en_sentence: It's actually not much of a ceremony.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実際は式という程の堅苦しいものでもないんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: We like to make everyone feel relaxed.
conversation.ja_sentence: みんなにリラックスしてもらいたいですから。

conversation.en_sentence: OK, I'm listening.
conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど。

conversation.en_sentence: You have piqued my interest.
conversation.ja_sentence: 面白そうだね。

conversation.en_sentence: I did not know that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 知らなかったよ。

conversation.en_sentence: That is a lot of paper.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは沢山の紙だね。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm not sure that's a good idea, Nancy.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕には何とも言えないなあ、ナンシー。

conversation.en_sentence: Because of more vulnerable customers.
conversation.ja_sentence: 弱いお客様もいるからさ。

conversation.en_sentence: Seniors, low-income populations, the disabled, and those on Indian Reservations and in rural areas who may not have access to the internet.
conversation.ja_sentence: 高齢者とか低所得者、身体障害者、インディアン保護区の人々や農村の人々なんか、インターネットにアクセスできない人々だよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Giving them the option is a good idea.
conversation.ja_sentence: 選べるようにするのはいいよね。

conversation.en_sentence: However, I believe anyone who chooses a paper invoice should not have to pay for it.
conversation.ja_sentence: だけど、紙の請求書を選んだからって料金を請求するべきではないと思うんだよなあ。

conversation.en_sentence: What if instead, you gave customers who wanted to go paperless an incentive?
conversation.ja_sentence: その代わりに、ペーパーレスを選んだお客様に何かあげるっていうのはどうかなあ。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't know, maybe a present.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分からないけど、プレゼントとか。

conversation.en_sentence: People love free stuff.
conversation.ja_sentence: タダでもらえるものはみんな好きだし。

conversation.en_sentence: What makes you think that?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしてそう思うの？

conversation.en_sentence: Are you sure you didn't misplace it?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何処かに置き忘れたんじゃないの？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, she never found it.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、結局見つからなかったよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you really think it's good idea?
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当にそれがいい案だと思うの？

conversation.en_sentence: Personally, I do not want to feel like being watched during a break.
conversation.ja_sentence: 個人的には休憩中にまで監視されるのは嫌だな。

conversation.en_sentence: I will never be able to feel relaxed.
conversation.ja_sentence: 全然リラックスできそうにない。

conversation.en_sentence: I guess installing a surveillance camera is feasible.
conversation.ja_sentence: まあ、監視カメラ設置は実行可能な事だろうね。

conversation.en_sentence: I hope we have enough budget for that.
conversation.ja_sentence: その為の予算があるといいよね。

conversation.en_sentence: I just can't believe anyone would do that on the job.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも業務中にそんな事をする人がいるなんて信じられないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: If caught, the person will lose his or her job.
conversation.ja_sentence: 捕まったら首になるんだから。

conversation.en_sentence: I do not wish to share an office with people like that.
conversation.ja_sentence: そんな人たちとオフィスを共にするのは嫌だね。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I hope your tablet turn up.
conversation.ja_sentence: タブレットが見つかるといいね。

conversation.en_sentence: You seem upset about something.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何か動揺しているみたいだね。

conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Gill from H Consultation?
conversation.ja_sentence: Hコンサルテーションのギル氏だろう？

conversation.en_sentence: No, I have not.
conversation.ja_sentence: いや、何も聞いてないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: What, where did you hear that?
conversation.ja_sentence: ええっ、どこで聞いたの？

conversation.en_sentence: I am so sorry you have to be at this meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: このミーティングに出席させるの申し訳ないね。

conversation.en_sentence: It is too late.
conversation.ja_sentence: もう遅いよ。

conversation.en_sentence: And it is unprofessional to cancel a meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: あとミーティングをキャンセルするなんてプロフェッショナルじゃないし。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh no, I do not know what to do.
conversation.ja_sentence: あーあ、どうすれば良いかわからないな。

conversation.en_sentence: You are so right.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君の言う通りだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: We do not want to put ourselves in hot water.
conversation.ja_sentence: 自らトラブルを起こすような事はしたくないね。

conversation.en_sentence: It's not our call.
conversation.ja_sentence: 我々が決めれる事ではないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Ok, we will get through this meeting and think of something else after that.
conversation.ja_sentence: とりあえずこのミーティングを終えて、それから何か策を考えてみよう。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you know who we are about to have a meeting with?
conversation.ja_sentence: 今から誰とミーティングするか知ってるの？

conversation.en_sentence: Haven't you heard about him?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼の話聞いた事ないの？

conversation.en_sentence: There is a rumor that he has been accused of sexual misconduct.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼は、セクハラ疑惑の噂があるのよ。

conversation.en_sentence: He has been notorious for making lewd comments and touching female coworkers inappropriately for a long time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼は性的発言したり、不適切なボディータッチをするとずっと有名だったの。

conversation.en_sentence: I wish I had known Company F was bringing him in for today's meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: F社が彼を連れてくると知ってたら良かったのに。

conversation.en_sentence: Honestly, I do not feel comfortable with him here.
conversation.ja_sentence: 正直なところ、彼の近くに居るのは居心地が悪い。

conversation.en_sentence: Can we just cancel it?
conversation.ja_sentence: キャンセルできないのかな？

conversation.en_sentence: This is going to taint our reputation once the word gets out that we are doing business with Mr. Gill.
conversation.ja_sentence: 我が社がギル氏と取引をしていると知れたら、評判が悪くなってしまうよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Sexual harassment accusation can destroy a company's good name.
conversation.ja_sentence: セクハラ疑惑があるだけで、会社の評判が台無しになる事もあるからね。

conversation.en_sentence: We might send a wrong message out to the public that we condone such awful behaviors.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちの会社は最低な言動を容認すると間違った印象を公に与えてしまうかもしれないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Is there anyway we exclude him from this meeting?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼を外してミーティングする手はないの？

conversation.en_sentence: The meeting is starting in 5 minutes.
conversation.ja_sentence: あと5分でミーティングが始まる。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: I think either before 9 o'clock or after 10 o'clock.
conversation.ja_sentence: 9時前か10時過ぎのどっちかだと思うけど。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: When I was in the Tokyo office, I'm usually super busy from 9 o'clock to 10 o'clock.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕が東京のオフィスにいた時は、9時から10時の間は大抵すごい忙しかったよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: That's when we have morning meetings and have to look at all our emails.
conversation.ja_sentence: 朝の会議があって、全Eメールに目を通さないといけない時間なんだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Well some guys get to the office early.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何人かはオフィスに早く着いてるよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: They go early to avoid the morning rush hour.
conversation.ja_sentence: 朝のラッシュアワーを避けるのに、早く行ってるんだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: The trains are super packed during rush hour.
conversation.ja_sentence: ラッシュアワーの時の電車はめちゃくちゃ混んでるからね。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I used to take the train during rush hour.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、僕はラッシュアワーに電車に乗ってたんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: I was literally in a sea of people.
conversation.ja_sentence: まさに、人の海の中にいたよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: It's not pretty when it's super hot and humid in the summer.
conversation.ja_sentence: 夏のすごい暑くて湿気がある時は居心地悪いよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: But yeah, I would give them a call at those times.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、その時間に電話するといいよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Did you send an email?
conversation.ja_sentence: メールは送った？

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Sounds like a plan.
conversation.ja_sentence: いい案だと思う。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I reviewed the applications and narrowed it down to two candidates.
conversation.ja_sentence: さてと、応募書類を確認して、二人の候補者に絞りました。

conversation.en_sentence: I wanted the candidates to have previous working experience in a related industry, and also have a good understanding of Japanese culture.
conversation.ja_sentence: 候補者には関連業界での経験、それから日本文化に明るいことを求めてたんで。

conversation.en_sentence: I also needed them to be fluent in Japanese so they can communicate with our Tokyo office.
conversation.ja_sentence: 東京オフィスと連絡を取るのに、日本語が流暢である必要もあったし。

conversation.en_sentence: I think what really made them stand out from the rest were their cover letter.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らが他の人より目を引いた一番の理由は、カバーレターだろうね。

conversation.en_sentence: Well aside from their experiences, they both wrote very well.
conversation.ja_sentence: まぁ、経験はさておき、二人ともすごく良く書けてたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: A lot of the other applicants had grammar mistakes and simply re-wrote what was on their resume.
conversation.ja_sentence: 他の応募者の多くは文法ミスがあったり、履歴書にあった内容を単純に書き直しただけだったからね。

conversation.en_sentence: Also, they both have experiences living in Japan and in the US.
conversation.ja_sentence: あと、二人とも日本とアメリカに住んだ経験があるし。

conversation.en_sentence: Maybe in the latter half of next week.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来週後半かな。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah I'm pretty sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: あぁ、ほぼ間違いなく。

conversation.en_sentence: There were some impressive candidates but some were a bit too overqualified.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何人か素晴らしい候補者はいたけど、ちょっと優秀すぎたかな。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう。

conversation.en_sentence: You'll be joining me in the interviews right?
conversation.ja_sentence: 一緒に面接に参加するよね？

conversation.en_sentence: Like, to help with documentations?
conversation.ja_sentence: 書類作成を手伝うため、とか？

conversation.en_sentence: Because I'm getting overloaded with them right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今、僕がそれで手一杯だからか。

conversation.en_sentence: I think that's a great idea.
conversation.ja_sentence: すごい良いアイディアだと思うよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Is our department able to handle another staff?
conversation.ja_sentence: うちの部署って他のスタッフを入れられるのかな？

conversation.en_sentence: Or do we have to wait until next fiscal year's budget?
conversation.ja_sentence: もしくは、次年度の予算まで待たなきゃならない？

conversation.en_sentence: I think we should make sure they have previous experience.
conversation.ja_sentence: 経験があるか確認したほうがいいと思うよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Understanding of Japanese culture.
conversation.ja_sentence: 日本文化の理解。

conversation.en_sentence: It might be tough working at a Japanese company like ours if they don't understand the work culture.
conversation.ja_sentence: もし職場文化をわかってなかったら、うちみたいな日本企業で働くのは大変だと思うよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I think that's about it?
conversation.ja_sentence: こんなもんかな？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh maybe experience handling export and import documents.
conversation.ja_sentence: あぁ、輸出入の書類を扱った経験かな。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh I get to see them too?
conversation.ja_sentence: えぇ、僕も見られるの？

conversation.en_sentence: That should be interesting.
conversation.ja_sentence: それ、面白そうだね。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, let's move on to the next topic.
conversation.ja_sentence: さて、次の議題に移ろうかな。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you, Sean.

conversation.ja_speaker: ナンシー ウィルソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that's the one.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、それです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ナンシー ウィルソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think there will be two of us and maybe two or three of them.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私たち２人と、向こうは２、３人になると思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ナンシー ウィルソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let me check on the numbers.
conversation.ja_sentence: 人数を確認させてください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ナンシー ウィルソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Should we book the table for twelve o'clock?
conversation.ja_sentence: １２時に予約を入れておきましょうか？

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Hey Sam, the meeting with Company A is on Friday this week, right?
conversation.ja_sentence: ちょっと、サム、A社とのミーティングは今週の金曜日だったよね？

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh what?
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ？

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Are you serious?
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当？

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, that's not good.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは困った。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: I just confirmed a meeting tomorrow.
conversation.ja_sentence: 明日、別のミーティングを承諾してしまった。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: It's a meeting for Project A.
conversation.ja_sentence: Aプロジェクトのミーティング。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, that one.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、それ。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: But yeah, I can't reschedule that one.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、だけど、それはリスケできないんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Thanks.
conversation.ja_sentence: 助かるよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: I won't be available on Monday and Tuesday afternoon.
conversation.ja_sentence: 月曜と火曜の午後はダメだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm pretty open on the other days.
conversation.ja_sentence: 他の日はかなり空いてる。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm really sorry about this.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当にすまんな。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for inviting me.
conversation.ja_sentence: お招きいただきましてありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: Sounds good.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Were the original buildings included?
conversation.ja_sentence: もともとの建物も込みで？

conversation.en_sentence: Did you have to apply for an air permit?
conversation.ja_sentence: 排出許可の申請は必要でしたか？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, why is that?
conversation.ja_sentence: へえ、それはまたどうして？

conversation.en_sentence: That's convenient.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは便利でしたね。

conversation.en_sentence: What's your production capacity?
conversation.ja_sentence: 生産能力はどのくらいですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Why is that?
conversation.ja_sentence: それはどうして？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, right.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、そう。

conversation.en_sentence: I saw that on the news.
conversation.ja_sentence: それ、ニュースで見ましたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Was the wildfire pretty close from here?
conversation.ja_sentence: その火事はここから近かったんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: When do you anticipate running at full capacity?
conversation.ja_sentence: いつフル稼働に戻れそうですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス キムさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi, you've reached Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、A社です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス キムさん
conversation.en_sentence: How may I help you?
conversation.ja_sentence: ご用件は？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス キムさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let me see if he is in the office today.
conversation.ja_sentence: えーと、今日出社しているかお調べします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス キムさん
conversation.en_sentence: Please hold.
conversation.ja_sentence: ちょっとお待ちください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス キムさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for holding.
conversation.ja_sentence: お待たせしました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス キムさん
conversation.en_sentence: So it seems he's not in the office right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: ただいま社内にいないようです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス キムさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think he may be out today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は外出していると思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス キムさん
conversation.en_sentence: Calling his cell phone might be the best way to reach him.
conversation.ja_sentence: 携帯に電話されるのが良いかもしれません。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス キムさん
conversation.en_sentence: Not a problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: いえ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス キムさん
conversation.en_sentence: Is there anything else I can help you with today?
conversation.ja_sentence: 本日、他には何かありますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス キムさん
conversation.en_sentence: Alright, have a good day.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか、では、良い1日を。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス キムさん
conversation.en_sentence: Bye now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 失礼します。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I am forever in debt to you.
conversation.ja_sentence: えっと、あなたには一生借りがあるから。

conversation.en_sentence: You were the first person who noticed me when I came here.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕がここに来た時に、最初に気づいてくれた人だからね。

conversation.en_sentence: Those were the days.
conversation.ja_sentence: そんな日もありました。

conversation.en_sentence: Everyone was so busy, absolutely no one realized I was just sitting there fiddling my fingers.
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆がとっても忙しくて、誰一人として、僕がただ座って手持無沙汰だったのに気づかなかったんだよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Even Dr. Toshinaga forgot I was there.
conversation.ja_sentence: 利永さんでさえ僕がそこにいるのを忘れてた。

conversation.en_sentence: Good times.
conversation.ja_sentence: いい時代だ。

conversation.en_sentence: I might as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、そうしようか。

conversation.en_sentence: I've, um, I've handed in my resignation.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕も、えーっと、今退職届を出しました。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm sorry everyone.
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆、ごめんな。

conversation.en_sentence: This was not an easy decision.
conversation.ja_sentence: 簡単に決められたことじゃないんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: I've been diagnosed with stress-induced ulcer and it got to a point where I need surgical intervention.
conversation.ja_sentence: ストレスが原因の胃潰瘍だって診断されて、手術する必要があるってとこまできてたんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: It's better I don't come back after my operation.
conversation.ja_sentence: 手術の後で戻ってこないほうがいいかと思って。

conversation.en_sentence: And it's not the first time they made these mistakes.
conversation.ja_sentence: それに、こういう失敗をしたのはこれが最初じゃないぞ。

conversation.en_sentence: But I'm glad you came to the board meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、君が役員会に来てくれてよかった。

conversation.en_sentence: Then would C Fund be on board with our proposal?
conversation.ja_sentence: で、Cファンドは、僕らの提案には賛成なの？

conversation.en_sentence: This is ultimately for the benefit of Company R, its research and its employees.
conversation.ja_sentence: これは最終的にはR社とその研究、従業員の利益になるんだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: If we let Keiko and Sylvester stay any longer those 2 are going to bulldoze their way to destruction.
conversation.ja_sentence: 利永さんと高さんがこれ以上長くいたら、二人で破滅に向けてまっしぐらだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I am talking to all of the investors right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今、全ての投資家と話しているところだ。

conversation.en_sentence: They are all considering joining.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らも皆、参加を考えてる。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, some don't want confrontation but I think it's unavoidable.
conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、対立するのを嫌がる人もいるけど、それは避けられないと思う。

conversation.en_sentence: I do plan to tread on this lightly, though.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、これは慎重に進めようと計画しているよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't want to drag this into a lawsuit or anything.
conversation.ja_sentence: これを訴訟なんかに持ち込むのは嫌だから。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, well, I've mentioned it in a roundabout way but haven't really discussed it until I know all the investors are on board.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、えっと、遠回しに話したんだけど、投資家たちが乗り気かどうか分かるまではと思ってちゃんとは議論していないんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Once I talk to L Company and get confirmation from your fund, I will set up a meeting for all of us to talk about how we are going to proceed.
conversation.ja_sentence: L社と話して、君のファンドから確認をもらったら、我々全員のミーティングを設定して、どうやって進めていくか話し合うことにするよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I called G Trading and they said a deal was already made.
conversation.ja_sentence: G貿易に電話をしたら、もうすでに取引が決まっていると言われました。

conversation.en_sentence: Why wasn't I informed of this?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうして教えていただけなかったんでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: You told me to contact G Trading.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私にG貿易に連絡をとるようにとおっしゃいましたよね。

conversation.en_sentence: I did so, and they thought I was calling in regards to the contract which I knew nothing about.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうしたら、私が全く知らない契約についての連絡だと思われていたようです。

conversation.en_sentence: I looked quite foolish.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私が馬鹿に見えてしまいましたが。

conversation.en_sentence: Excuse me, this is not about me, it's about how this company is perceived by others.
conversation.ja_sentence: あのすいません、これは私がどうのこうのではなく、会社が周りにどう見られてるかについてなんですが。

conversation.en_sentence: With me calling them cluelessly, I am pretty sure G Trading got the impression that we are not as organized as they thought we would be.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何も分からず私が電話をしたことで、G貿易は、うちの会社が思ったほどきちんとしていないという印象を受けたと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: If you shared information with me, this would not have happened.
conversation.ja_sentence: もし情報を共有してくだされば、こんなことにはならなかったのですが。

conversation.en_sentence: How can he be so tone deaf and patronizing at the same time?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうやったら、あれだけ空気が読めないと同時に人を見下せるんでしょうね。

conversation.en_sentence: Does he even hear himself?
conversation.ja_sentence: 自分で自分の言ってることが聞こえてるんでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: Is this what you went through as well?
conversation.ja_sentence: ジョンさんもこういう経験をされてきたのですか？

conversation.en_sentence: But what if we need some sort of executive decision?
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、何か執行部の決断が必要な時はどうするんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Ko, it's hard for Yumi to make calls with limited information on hand.
conversation.ja_sentence: 高さん、手元にある限られた情報だけで電話をするなんて、由美さんには大変ですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: It would have helped if she knew about the deal so she could talk with them professionally.
conversation.ja_sentence: 取引について知らされていれば、それが助けになって彼女ももっとプロらしく話せたと思いますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: That really went around in circles, didn't it?
conversation.ja_sentence: あれは本当に堂々巡りだったね。

conversation.en_sentence: I wonder what made him think I knew about the G Trading deal when he is so secretive about everything?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼は、何でも隠しておくくせに、どうして僕がG貿易との取引について知ってると思ったんだろう。

conversation.en_sentence: This is the reason no one really talks to him.
conversation.ja_sentence: だから、誰も彼と話さないんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: It goes around in circles, and we never reach a conclusion.
conversation.ja_sentence: 堂々巡りで、全然結論が出ないんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm sorry you had to go through this, but you just have to let it roll off your back.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんなことを経験しなくちゃいけなくて悪いね、でも、スルーしたほうがいいよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Otherwise, you'll end up being angry all the time.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうじゃないと、いつも怒っていないといけない。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, my first year here was a mess, but Mari helped me out.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、最初の一年はむちゃくちゃだったけど、真理さんに助けてもらった。

conversation.en_sentence: You got great colleagues, so you are in good company.
conversation.ja_sentence: いい同僚たちがいるし、いい仲間がいる。

conversation.en_sentence: We all go directly to Dr. Toshinaga.
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆、利永さんのところに直接行くんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: At the end of the day she's the CEO so she has the final say.
conversation.ja_sentence: 結局のところ、彼女がCEOで、最終的な決定権を持つからね。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, yeah you weren't there.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、君はいなかったよね。

conversation.en_sentence: We were there, but it was just the same old, same old.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕たちは行ったけど、毎年毎年同じ感じだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Did you have something come up?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何か用事があったの？

conversation.en_sentence: Big project?
conversation.ja_sentence: 大きなプロジェクト？

conversation.en_sentence: I think I heard something about that at the all-staff meeting last month, yeah.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、先月の全社ミーティングで何か聞いたような気がするな。

conversation.en_sentence: Well that's a sudden change in direction.
conversation.ja_sentence: へえ、それは急に方向性が変わったな。

conversation.en_sentence: What gives?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしたんだろ。

conversation.en_sentence: And you got enlisted for it!
conversation.ja_sentence: で、君がそこに入ったってことか！

conversation.en_sentence: Congratulations!
conversation.ja_sentence: おめでとう！

conversation.en_sentence: I'm sorry about the timing though.
conversation.ja_sentence: タイミングのことは気の毒だけどね。

conversation.en_sentence: Ugh, that brings up bad memories.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、嫌なこと思い出しちゃったな。

conversation.en_sentence: See you.
conversation.ja_sentence: またな。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi, this is Sam from Company B.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、B社のサムです。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm calling in regards to an invoice I received from your company today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日届きました御社の請求書についてお電話差し上げたのですが。

conversation.en_sentence: I was just looking at the unit rate and it seems like there was an error.
conversation.ja_sentence: 単価のところなんですが、どうも間違っているようなんです。

conversation.en_sentence: The invoice is showing five hundred fifty dollars per metric ton when it should be five hundred twenty dollars per metric ton.
conversation.ja_sentence: 請求書には、メートルトンごとに550ドルとなっているんですが、メートルトン当たり520ドルのはずなんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, the invoice number is 09832.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、請求書番号は09832です。

conversation.en_sentence: We just received the invoice from your company earlier today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日早くに御社の請求書を受け取ったところなんですが。

conversation.en_sentence: We actually negotiated a new price with your company last week.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は、先週、御社の方と新しい料金について交渉したところだったんですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: So the five hundred fifty dollars is actually the old price.
conversation.ja_sentence: だから、550ドルは前の値段なんです。

conversation.en_sentence: We spoke with your sales manager, Tom Grant.
conversation.ja_sentence: 営業マネージャーのトムグラントさんと話しました。

conversation.en_sentence: That would be great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 助かります。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much for your help.
conversation.ja_sentence: お手数おかけしました。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございました。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi, this is Sam from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、A社のサムですが。

conversation.en_sentence: How are you today, Don.
conversation.ja_sentence: ドンさん、お元気ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I was just wondering if you guys had sent the invoice for last month's shipment.
conversation.ja_sentence: 先月配送分の請求書を送っていただいたかどうかの確認なんですが。

conversation.en_sentence: We usually receive it pretty early but haven't seen anything yet.
conversation.ja_sentence: 通常、かなり早く受け取るんですが、まだ何も来ていないので。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, the order number is 24379.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、発注番号は24379です。

conversation.en_sentence: It's the one for twenty metric tons.
conversation.ja_sentence: 20メートルトンの分です。

conversation.en_sentence: We usually get it by email from your administration department.
conversation.ja_sentence: 普通はそちらの総務部からメールで届きます。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, do you know when that was sent out?
conversation.ja_sentence: ほお、いつ送られたか分かりますか？

conversation.en_sentence: That would be great.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは助かります。

conversation.en_sentence: No, that will be all.
conversation.ja_sentence: いえ、それだけです。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much for your help.
conversation.ja_sentence: お世話になり助かりました。

conversation.en_sentence: Bye now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 失礼いたします。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Henry, this is Sam from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、ヘンリーさん、A社のサムです。

conversation.en_sentence: How are you doing today?
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日はいかがお過ごしですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I just wanted to follow up on the email I sent you around two weeks ago in regards to setting up a meeting with you and your colleague.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたと同僚の方との会議を設定したいという二週間前に送ったメールのフォローをさせていただきたいと思いまして。

conversation.en_sentence: That's odd, I didn't get your reply.
conversation.ja_sentence: おかしいですね、お返事は来てないですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Not a problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫ですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for advising your availability.
conversation.ja_sentence: 予定を教えてくださって助かります。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll check with my manager on his availability and I'll get back to you on this.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちのマネージャーの予定をチェックして、この件お返事します。

conversation.en_sentence: We can have it at our office.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちのオフィスで出来ますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Once we confirm the date and time, I'll send an email invitation.
conversation.ja_sentence: 日時を決めたら、メールで招待を送ります。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much for your time today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日はお時間ありがとうございました。

conversation.en_sentence: Will be in touch.
conversation.ja_sentence: また連絡します。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi, this is Sam from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、A社のサムです。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, hi Jim, Happy New Years.
conversation.ja_sentence: おお、ジムさん、明けましておめでとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I can do that.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、出来ますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: People are just coming back from their holiday break so I might not be able to get a reply until next week.
conversation.ja_sentence: みんな休み明けで戻ってきたところなので、来週まで返事はもらえないかも知れないですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Will that be okay?
conversation.ja_sentence: それでもいいですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Do you know if the customer on your side will be buying more this year?
conversation.ja_sentence: そちらの顧客に今年もっと購入する予定があるかどうか知っていますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, that would be great.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、助かります。

conversation.en_sentence: It'd be nice if I can tell the supplier an estimated volume.
conversation.ja_sentence: 供給業者にどの程度の量か見積を教えられたらいいなと思うので。

conversation.en_sentence: If the customer is buying more, then I can maybe negotiate a better price for your customer.
conversation.ja_sentence: もし顧客がもっと購入するようであれば、あなたの顧客向けの値段の交渉がしやすくなりますからね。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll get back to you with an offer as soon as I can.
conversation.ja_sentence: できるだけすぐにオファーについて連絡しますね。

conversation.en_sentence: Alright, have a good one then.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、また良い一日を。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you want to go for lunch?
conversation.ja_sentence: お昼食べに行かない？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I was thinking of trying somewhere new.
conversation.ja_sentence: どこか新しいところがいいと思っていたんだけれど。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: My customer was asking me to take him to a new place next time he visits.
conversation.ja_sentence: お客さんが次に来た時に新しい所に連れて行って欲しいと言っていたから。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, the president of Company A.

conversation.en_sentence: We do have a similar product if the specification of that works with you.

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャック メンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I can send you the specification sheet.

conversation.en_sentence: Alright I will send it to you shortly.

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャック メンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let me know if you're interested in purchasing this product.
conversation.ja_sentence: この製品のご購入に興味があればご連絡ください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャック メンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Not a problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: どういたしまして。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャック メンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Have a good one.
conversation.ja_sentence: よい一日を。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, hi Mr. Saito.
conversation.ja_sentence: あぁ、こんにちは、サイトウさん。

conversation.en_sentence: How are you today?

conversation.en_sentence: With Company A right.
conversation.ja_sentence: A社とですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Unfortunately, no.

conversation.en_sentence: Well, maybe we can ask Company A to introduce us to someone at Company B.

conversation.en_sentence: It can't hurt to ask right.
conversation.ja_sentence: 聞く分には構わないよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Otherwise, we have to try to contact Company B through their contact form on their website.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしくはB社のウェブサイトのコンタクトフォームから連絡してみるしかないですね。

conversation.en_sentence: I rarely get any replies through that.

conversation.en_sentence: Got it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました。

conversation.en_sentence: He was on contract right?

conversation.ja_sentence: 更新したくなかったの？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, where to?
conversation.ja_sentence: へぇ、どこへ？

conversation.en_sentence: That sounds fun.
conversation.ja_sentence: 楽しそうだね。

conversation.en_sentence: I never really got to know him after all these months.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何か月も経ったのに、結局彼のことはあまり知れなかった。

conversation.en_sentence: Same here.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕も同じ。

conversation.en_sentence: The back door is closer to the washroom.
conversation.ja_sentence: 裏のドアの方がトイレに近いからね。

conversation.en_sentence: Who knows.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分からないな。

conversation.en_sentence: I think Elaine will miss him.
conversation.ja_sentence: イレインは寂しがるね。

conversation.en_sentence: I know she often asked him to send export documents by courier.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女はよく彼に宅配で輸出の書類を送るよう頼んでたから。

conversation.en_sentence: Company A?
conversation.ja_sentence: A社？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, that company.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、あの会社ですか。

conversation.en_sentence: Let me check my emails to see who we contacted last time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 前回誰に連絡を取ったかEメールをチェックしてみましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay I found the contact.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、連絡先を見つけましたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Are you available next week?
conversation.ja_sentence: 来週都合は良いですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Alright.
conversation.ja_sentence: 了解です。

conversation.en_sentence: Actually, I'm going on a business trip early next week.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、来週初めは私が出張に行くんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: It's just a day trip on Monday.
conversation.ja_sentence: 月曜だけの日帰りです。

conversation.en_sentence: So I'll see if I can set up a meeting for Tuesday onwards.
conversation.ja_sentence: なので火曜日以降に会議を設定できるか聞いてみますね。

conversation.en_sentence: Did the Tokyo office send you any presentation file in regards to the business idea?
conversation.ja_sentence: 東京支社は事業案のプレゼン資料を送ってくれましたか？

conversation.en_sentence: I hope they are making it in English.
conversation.ja_sentence: 英語で作ってくれてると良いですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I really hope it's in English.
conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、ほんとに英語だと良いですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Are there any good restaurants to take a client?
conversation.ja_sentence: クライアントをお連れするのに良いレストランはありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Lunch.
conversation.ja_sentence: ランチです。

conversation.en_sentence: Like restaurant A across the street?
conversation.ja_sentence: 通りの向こうのAレストランみたいな？

conversation.en_sentence: How about for Japanese?
conversation.ja_sentence: 日本食はどうでしょう？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh?
conversation.ja_sentence: えーと？

conversation.en_sentence: What's it called?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何ていうところですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Why's that?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしてですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, that's not good.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、それは駄目ですね。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll keep that in mind.
conversation.ja_sentence: 覚えておきます。

conversation.en_sentence: Are there any other Japanese restaurants in the area?
conversation.ja_sentence: 他にも近所に日本食レストランはありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Really.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんですか。

conversation.en_sentence: That's really surprising.
conversation.ja_sentence: とても意外ですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: What are you working on there Sam?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何の作業してるんだい、サム？

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, interesting.
conversation.ja_sentence: おもしろいね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: How is it going so far?
conversation.ja_sentence: うまくいってる？

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: I hear there has been a lot of consolidation in the paper industry.
conversation.ja_sentence: 紙産業では合併が多くあったらしいね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: How much do you know about paper products.
conversation.ja_sentence: 紙製品についてどれだけ知ってるんだい？

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think I might know a guy in that industry.
conversation.ja_sentence: その業界に知り合いがいるかもしれない。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you want me to ask if he knows of any suppliers for this paper product?
conversation.ja_sentence: この紙製品のサプライヤを知っているか聞いてみようか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: His office is actually pretty close from here.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は彼のオフィスはここからとても近いんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Why don't I set up a meeting?
conversation.ja_sentence: ミーティングを設けようか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Not a problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: とんでもない。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: When will you be free?
conversation.ja_sentence: いつが空いてる？

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you so much!
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当にありがとう！

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン サイモンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We will now start out panel discussion.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今から討論会を始めます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン サイモンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We have with us Jenny Lee from Company A, and Thomas Singh from Company B today.
conversation.ja_sentence: A社のジェニー リーさん、B社のトマス シンさんをお迎えしています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン サイモンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's a pleasure to have you guys here.
conversation.ja_sentence: お越しいただき光栄です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン サイモンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So since today's topic is about entering the Japanese market, I'd like to ask our panel today on what difficulty they faced.
conversation.ja_sentence: では今日のテーマが日本市場参入ですので、本日の議論参加者の方々に、どのような苦労があったかお聞きしたいと思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン サイモンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let's start with you Jenny.
conversation.ja_sentence: ジェニーさんからいきましょうか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン サイモンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Did you think this was the right decision?
conversation.ja_sentence: それは正しい判断だったと思われますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン サイモンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Was there any other difficulties you faced?
conversation.ja_sentence: その他に直面した困難はありましたか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン サイモンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for sharing your experience Jenny.
conversation.ja_sentence: ジェニー、あなたの経験を共有してくれてありがとうございました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン サイモンさん
conversation.en_sentence: How about you Thomas.
conversation.ja_sentence: トマスさん、あなたはいかがですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン サイモンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Very interesting.
conversation.ja_sentence: とても興味深いですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン サイモンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you both for sharing your experiences.
conversation.ja_sentence: お二人とも経験を共有して頂き、ありがとうございました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ロン サイモンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Now let's go to the next topic.
conversation.ja_sentence: では次のテーマに移りましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: That's correct.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、その通りです。

conversation.en_sentence: Sounds good.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Please go ahead.
conversation.ja_sentence: お先にお願いします。

conversation.en_sentence: Is there storage on site?
conversation.ja_sentence: サイトに倉庫はありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Are workers here unionized?
conversation.ja_sentence: 従業員は組合に入ってますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah so we are planning to export agricultural goods in bulk.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、私たちは農業製品を大量に輸出する予定です。

conversation.en_sentence: It will be around five hundred tons a month.
conversation.ja_sentence: だいたい月500トンくらいですね。

conversation.en_sentence: So I think it would work well if we would be able to store the product in your covered storage.
conversation.ja_sentence: だから屋根付き倉庫に私たちの製品を貯蔵できるといいな、と思います。

conversation.en_sentence: I think it will be around next spring.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来春頃になるかと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: In the meantime, it would be great if we can review the fee structure for the terminal here.
conversation.ja_sentence: それまでにこのターミナルの料金体系を見直しできればと思っています。

conversation.en_sentence: That would be great.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうしてもらえるとありがたいです。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for the overview.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大要を説明して頂いてありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョアン リウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi Ian, this is Joanne from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、イアンさん、A社のジョアンです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョアン リウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Super busy today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日はものすごく忙しくて。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョアン リウさん
conversation.en_sentence: I got a request from the customer that he needs to switch the shipment schedule for this week and next week.
conversation.ja_sentence: 輸送のスケジュールを今週と来週に変更しないといけないお客様からご依頼があって。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョアン リウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that's correct.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、そうなんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョアン リウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you think this can be done?
conversation.ja_sentence: できそうですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョアン リウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Of course.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョアン リウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you so much!
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます！

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョアン リウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Really appreciate your support.
conversation.ja_sentence: 助けてくださってありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョアン リウさん
conversation.en_sentence: I understand.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、分かりました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョアン リウさん
conversation.en_sentence: I will talk to the customer and try to avoid emergency requests like this.
conversation.ja_sentence: お客様と話をして、こういった緊急のリクエストがないようにします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョアン リウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Nope, I'm all good.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、大丈夫です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョアン リウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much and have a good day.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございました、よい一日を！

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Elaine, can you help me with catering?
conversation.ja_sentence: エレインさん、こんにちは、ケータリングの手伝いをしてくれますか？

conversation.en_sentence: I have a meeting from 10 o'clock to 2 o'clock and will need to arrange lunch in the office for the guests.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私は10時から2時まで会議が入っているのですが、オフィスでお客様の昼食の準備をしなくてはならないんです。

conversation.en_sentence: There will be 6 including myself.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私を含めて6人です。

conversation.en_sentence: The usual will be fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: いつもと同じで大丈夫です。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that one.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうそう、それです。

conversation.en_sentence: It'd be great if you can get some smoked salmon and roast beef.
conversation.ja_sentence: スモークサーモンとローストビーフを買ってきて頂けると嬉しいです。

conversation.en_sentence: One of the guest really likes smoked salmon.
conversation.ja_sentence: お客様の1人がスモークサーモンがとてもお好きなので。

conversation.en_sentence: What do they have?
conversation.ja_sentence: どんな種類がありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Let's get half and half.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、半分ずつにしましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't think so.
conversation.ja_sentence: 無いと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: Actually, let me double-check and I'll get back to you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 念の為再度確認してまた伝えます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジム ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Alright, let's do a quick wrapup meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、最終確認会議を進めましょう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジム ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: What did you guys think of the company?
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さんは、この会社についてどう思いましたか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジム ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sam, can I get you to do some research then?
conversation.ja_sentence: では、サムさん、調べておいていただけますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジム ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you try to find some market reports on the industry?
conversation.ja_sentence: この業界の市況報告を探してみていただけますか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジム ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think it is important for us to understand the scale of the industry and who the major players are.
conversation.ja_sentence: 業界の規模と業界大手について理解する事が大切だと思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジム ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: How much time do you think you'll need?
conversation.ja_sentence: どのくらいの時間がかかると思いますか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジム ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Alright, sounds good.
conversation.ja_sentence: それでいいです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジム ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Ben, can I ask you to talk to the banks and accounting firms to see what the reputation of this Company A is?
conversation.ja_sentence: ベンさん、銀行と会計事務所に連絡を取ってA社の評判を聞いてみていただけますか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジム ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Great.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジム ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sam, can you also make today's meeting minutes?
conversation.ja_sentence: サムさん、あと今日のミーティングについてまとめていただけないでしょうか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジム ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: I was busy listening and didn't take down much notes.
conversation.ja_sentence: 話を聞くのに精一杯でメモはあまり取っていませんでした。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジム ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: I appreciate it.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ロビンソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sam, do you have a moment?
conversation.ja_sentence: サム、ちょっと時間ある？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ロビンソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I need you to prepare a company presentation for next week's event.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来週の会社イベント用のプレゼンの準備をしてほしいんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ロビンソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: The one made by our head office?
conversation.ja_sentence: 本社が作ったプレゼンのこと？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ロビンソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think we should include a bit about what we do at our branch.
conversation.ja_sentence: この支社でどんなことをやっているか、少し加えたほうがいいと思う。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ロビンソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you make a couple of slides that explains our branch's operations?
conversation.ja_sentence: 支社の事業を説明するようなスライドを２、３枚つくってくれないかな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ロビンソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah that would be great.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、それはいいね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ロビンソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Be sure to add pictures.
conversation.ja_sentence: 写真もいれてください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ロビンソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You don't want to bore the audience with just texts.
conversation.ja_sentence: 文字ばかりだと見ている人が飽きるからね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ロビンソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I need the final version by next Monday.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来週の月曜までに最終版ができればいい。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ロビンソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It would be great if you can make a draft by the end of tomorrow though.
conversation.ja_sentence: だけど、明日中に原稿をみせてもらえれば助かるよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ロビンソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Great.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいねえ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ロビンソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Please send it to me when you're done.
conversation.ja_sentence: できたら、送っておいてください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: As soon as possible.
conversation.ja_sentence: できるだけ早く。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But don't forget about the time difference.
conversation.ja_sentence: あっ、だけど、時差に気をつけて。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, you don't want to call them when they are still sleeping.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、向こうがまだ寝てる時間に電話しないほうがいいからね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: What are you planning to talk about with him?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何を話すの？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Make sure to tell him the reason for the delay.
conversation.ja_sentence: 遅れる理由もちゃんと伝えないとだめだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Kinoshita will definitely ask for the reason.
conversation.ja_sentence: 木下さんは、絶対に理由をきいてくるよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you imagine what he will say if you say I don't know?
conversation.ja_sentence: 理由はわかりませんと言ったら、木下さんが何と言うか想像できるだろう？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Don't forget to ask if there are other alternatives.
conversation.ja_sentence: 他の手段がないかも忘れずに聞いて。
